resource.name: Traffic Incidents
resource.description: This is an unofficial archive of traffic incidents within Calgary. Traffic incidents are traffic disruptions affecting traffic flow, such as traffic signal issues, hazardous road conditions, stalled vehicles, and unverified, unreported traffic collisions. This data is based off unrecorded imagery where traffic cameras are present. There may be gaps in the data due to system or script malfunction. For more information, see the Calgary Traffic Report page.

resource.name: Building Permits
resource.description: Building permit applications made to The City of Calgary's Planning & Development department. For general requests please contact propertyresearch@calgary.ca. Visit the Calgary.ca building permit process FAQ to learn more about The City's building permit process.

resource.name: Waste and Recycling Collection Schedule
resource.description: To look up your address, download a calendar, or get a reminder for your next pickup date, visit: Garbage, recycling and composting pickup schedule This dataset is a compilation of residential schedules for the entire city for black, blue and green bin collection. (Updated to include Summer and Winter Collection schedules).

Interval or frequency of collection: Every = collected once a week. Odd, Even = collected every two weeks. Week of July 17, 2017 is start date for EVEN collection frequency.

resource.name: Traffic Cameras
resource.description: View up-to-the-minute traffic camera images of current road conditions on major routes as well as other key intersections. *These cameras are solely for traffic monitoring and not enforcement. Camera footage is not recorded. Cameras can be down for maintenance or in the case of collisions, to protect the identity of those involved.*

resource.name: Calgary Business Licences
resource.description: This file includes the licensed businesses in the City of Calgary. Data fields include: Trade name, Business Location, Creation Date, Status, Licence Type and Community District of the business. All businesses created before October 7, 1994 reflect this date as their anniversary date. Not all business require a municipal licence but may still require licensing, permits or inspections from other regulatory bodies. For more information on business licensing, visit: Manage your business
columns_description: Expiry date of business licence
Date licence was first issued
Licences that apply to the business

•Pending Recommendation - The minimum requirements for that specific licence have not all been met so the Licence status is pending. •Pending Renewal - 60 days prior to expiry •Renewal Invoiced - 45 days prior to the Business Licence expiring, a renewal invoice is generated and mailed out.  The status of the Business Licence will read as Pending Renewal/Renewal Invoiced until the invoice is paid or the expiry of the Licence. •Expired - The licence has lapsed and the renewal has not been paid  •Invoiced - The business has met all licensing requirements and an invoice has been mailed. The business is not licensed until the invoice is paid. •Licensed - All requirements have been met, the invoice has been paid and this new business is currently licensed. •Renewal Licensed - This is a renewal licence that has been paid.
Community Name
Business Licence ID
Home based business (Y/N)

resource.name: Policy Plan Boundaries
resource.description: A policy plan boundary defines the area that is covered by a policy plan document. This includes Area Redevelopment Plans (ARP), Area Structure Plans (ASP), Community Plans, Regional Policy Plans, Regional Context Studies, Intermunicipal Development Plans, Station Area Plans, Design Briefs, Special Studies and other Policy Plans.
columns_description: Spatial extents of the plan area

Link to the document
Status of document (e.g. approved, in preparation, etc.)
Type of plan
Name of document

resource.name: Healthy Rivers Sub Watersheds
resource.description: The polygons delineate the boundaries of each of the major sub-watersheds within City of Calgary boundaries. These include Bow River Direct, Elbow River, Fish Creek, Nose Creek, Pine Creek and Shepard Wetland/Western Headworks Canal. The sub-watersheds delineate the major drainage areas within The City. Polygons should be layered over an orthophoto of Calgary, with the rivers, creeks and streams visible. This data is updated on an as needed basis by Watershed Strategy and has been simplified for viewing purposes.

domain_tags: pine creek and shepard wetland/western headworks canal

resource.name: Vaccination Locations
resource.description: This dataset is a list of vaccination locations. The information includes address, vaccine type, booking and contact information for the vaccination locations. The information is updated daily.

resource.name: Surface Water Quality Sonde Data – Monitoring Locations
resource.description:
This dataset is compiled from The City of Calgary’s in situ (in location) water quality monitoring program. In situ field measures are acquired from the deployment of unattended multi-parameter sondes in surface waters by The City of Calgary.

This dataset consists of the monitoring locations. For the data collected, please see: https://data.calgary.ca/Environment/Water-Quality-Monitoring-Sonde-Data/kc8x-fu3f/about_data
columns_description: Continuous: In situ measurements logged at regular intervals (e.g. 15 minutes) for an extended period of time. Discrete: Individual in situ measurements manually collected by a field technician.

resource.name: Dangerous Goods Truck Routes
resource.description: A digital graphical representation of truck routes within Calgary.

resource.name: Civic Census by Ward and Dwelling Structure
resource.description: Ward-level tabulations of annual census counts of residents, dwellings, and dwelling occupancy, categorized by dwelling structure type. Ward boundaries can change over time. These results are based on the ward boundaries at the time of data collection in each year.
columns_description: Year the data was collected
Municipal electoral ward
Refers to the physical building or structure in which the dwelling unit is located. It is not a reference to the use or ownership of the dwelling.
Description of the dwelling type.
Count of dwellings
Count of dwelling units under construction. A dwelling unit is considered under construction as as soon as the foundation is poured, and until it is ready for occupancy.

Count of inactive dwelling units. A dwelling unit that is part of a multi-dwelling unit structure and is being used as part of another dwelling unit in the same physical structure (e.g. both halves of a duplex used by one family); or a vacant pad in a mobile home park; or a converted structure unit like a basement suite, which is not occupied as a dwelling unit, has not been removed, is not being renovated but is not available for occupancy; or a dwelling unit that has been boarded-up, scheduled for demolition, fenced or taped off, condemned, or otherwise uninhabitable.
Count of dwelling units vacant because of renovations
Count of dwellings occupied by home owners
Count of dwelling units uninhabited at the time of the census, but suitable and available for occupancy
Count of dwellings with confirmed residents
Numerical code of the dwelling type.

Count of residents. A person who maintains residence in the city is considered a resident. Residents include newly arrived persons, persons absent for educational purposes, persons temporarily at remote work sites, etc.
Count of structures or units originally built as a dwelling and which could be used as a dwelling again, but which is presently used for a non-residential purpose (e.g. show home)

resource.name: Building Energy and Emissions Performance by Property Type - BenchmarkYYC
resource.description:
This dataset is derived from BenchmarkYYC and contains annual, aggregated building energy and emissions data categorized by primary property type. All energy and greenhouse gas emission metrics are calculated by ENERGY STAR Portfolio Manager.

All cells containing zeros signify that zero is the calculated value for that cell. All blank cells represent data points that are "not available" because they do not exist or cannot be calculated.

The energy and emissions data fields that are collected are subject to change each reporting year.

resource.name: 1:200 Flood Map (0.5% chance of occurring in any year)
resource.description:
(Note: Updated inundation maps for 1:2 to 1:1000 floods are available from Alberta Environment and Parks (2020). The new draft maps can be viewed here: https://floods.alberta.ca/?app_code=FI&mapType=Draft)
These inundation maps show whether a property is at risk for various sized river floods. The size of flood shown on this map has a 1/200 or a 0.5% chance of occurring in any year.
The three distinct types of inundation shown on the maps are:
o Inundation - Area flooded overland due to riverbank overtopping.
o Isolated - Low lying areas that will not be wet from riverbank overtopping, but may experience groundwater seepage or stormwater backup.
o Protected - Area protected by a permanent flood barrier.
The flood areas shown are based on Alberta Environment and Parks most recent (2020) inundation maps. There is uncertainty inherent in predicting the effects of flood events, and this uncertainty increases for floods with less than a 1% chance of occurrence in any year. Any use of this data must recognizing the uncertainty with regards to the exact location and extent of flooding.
More information on flood mapping for Calgary is available at https://calgary.ca/flood
For Calgary's River Flood story, see: https://maps.calgary.ca/RiverFlooding/
columns_description: m^3/s
